column1: Before 1 September 2022, will the government of the United Arab Emirates (UAE) officially announce a change to its weekend?

column6: Bringing my probability down after hearing this podcast with the owner of a recruitment agency in Dubai https://www.thenationalnews.com/business/money/2021/08/24/is-a-four-day-working-week-possible-in-the-uae-pocketful-of-dirhams/

The UAE is officially a Muslim country and Friday is the holy day of the week, like Sunday is for Christians. Therefore, it is highly unlikely (95-99%) that the government shifts the weekend to Saturday-Sunday by 2022. Doing such a move could backlash politically, also from other Muslim countries.
Too much resistance from religious conservatives within own and neighbouring countries
I found this article dated to 2003, which discusses should the UAE opt for "Friday-Saturday" as the weekend or not? https://gulfnews.com/uae/two-day-weekend-which-day-to-club-with-friday-1.362545
Half-day on Friday seems feasible but it is still unlikely.
